Title: Hire Cybersecurity Expert
Description: +1 to station played on and can protect any station within a single connection. Goes away upon successful attack and nullifies a single attack OR can be used to nullify a lateral movement card on any station within its sphere of influence.

Title: Old Style Forensics Capability
Description: +1 to station. A forensics tool for old style modems bought. Issues can now be ascertained on fifteen- to  twenty-five year old hardware.

Title: Train employees
Description: +1 to station. Train employees in ICS cybersecurity. IT and Industrial Control Systems (ICS) have different security needs.

Title: Emergency Plan Upgraded
Description: +1 to station. Facility's emergency plan has been upgraded to include the latest cyberinfrastructure attack potentials.

Title: Comprehensive Backup Plan
Description: +1 to station. Also protects against ransomware.

Title: Vulnerable to Phishing
Description: Employees opened email and either clicked a link or opened an attachment sent from an attacker.

Title: Field Devices Vulnerable
Description: Access gained via field devices. Field devices such as transformers and wind farms have a vulnerable technology like Bluetooth embedded that can't be turned off.

Title: Ransomware
Description: Your business machines have been infected with ransomware and all the hackers care about is that you pay them.

Title: Virus Checking Software Installed
Description: Somebody installed virus checking software that causes a denial of service attack of up to 6 minutes on the industrial control system because it interrupts real-time operations. The Denial of Service self attack was unintended.

Title: Control and Safety Implemented Together
Description: Control and safety features are implemented into the same hardware. Safety is now vulnerable.

Title: Alarm Suppression
Description: A local software misconfiguration or vulnerability is used to gain access and the alarm functionality of the system is suppressed.

Title: Service Modification Malware
Description: Attackers use a service modification to load malware and gain access.

Title: Functionality Not Separate
Description: Your business and industrial control system networks aren’t completely separate or your control safety systems are on the same hardware. Anything not separated can be attacked together.

Title: Lateral Movement
Description: The last played vulnerability on this station moves to all stations directly connected to it if the vulnerability becomes an actual attack.

Title: Offline
Description: Station or substation offline. Something is wrong.

Title: Output Fluctuates Through Brute Force I/O
Description: Access gained and on/off commands were switched. Causes output to fluctuate unnaturally.

Title: Compliance is Enough
Description: (Instant) -1! Compliance does not equal complete security but your people believe it does. You drove a car with a valid driver's license at the proper speed limit. You still had an accident.

Title: Authentication Provides Confidentiality
Description: (Instant) -1! Access and privacy are two separate things. You were logged in but your data was still stolen over that unencrypted wi-fi.

Title: Change Password
Description: Make users choose a new and stronger password. Counters phishing and vulnerable field device vulnerabilities.

Title: Firewall Log Review
Description: Firewall logs are reviewed and lateral movement discovered. Cancels Lateral movement card.

Title: Pay Ransom
Description: You pay the ransom. Roll dice and if you get a 19 or 20 you get all your data back. If you get greater than a 10 you get some data back and take a -1 damage to your facility. Lose all points for the attack if you get a 10 or below. Note that 80% of companies that pay the ransom are attacked a second time in the future.

Title: Restart and Patch
Description: System is restarted and patched. Roll a die to determine if the specialized ICS patch actually works for your facility. Failure is rolling a 1 or 2. Can fix Alarm Suppression, virus checking software installation, Brute Force I/O, or Service Modification Malware. Failure means the attack happens.

Title: Separate Functionality
Description: Separate functionality to increase security. This can be business IT and Industrial Control System (ICS) functionality or even safety and control system hardware.

Title: Repair Technician
Description: Send a repair technician to fix anything physical including brute force attacks, mechanical breakdowns, and offline facilities.

Title: Run Analytics
Description: Run analytics on user/system behavior to notice and then stop an outsider from accessing networks. Stops access from phishing and vulnerable field devices.

Title: HALT
Description: Cancels any instant action. Somebody was on the ball today.

Title: Wrong IP
Description: Attacker uses the wrong IP for a relay switch open command and  nothing happens. Fixes Brute Force I/O and happened during 2016 Ukraine Power Grid Attack.

Title: Patch Siemens Relay Exploit
Description: +1 to station. Patch Siemens mechanical relay exploit (stops any relay issues on that station).

Title: Physically Reset Devices
Description: Physically reset devices in a facility. Used for Brute Force I/O and Stations that are not working. Can only be used on stations with the Siemens mechancial relay exploit patched or else station explodes (-5 pt) and life is lost.

Title: Sewage Dumped
Description: (Used on Water Only)  Brute Force I/O attack sent false messages via radio network using a stolen machine to disable alarm reporting and corrupt a water pump system to run incorrectly. Can't be played on a station with upgraded SCADA access authentication.

Title: Mechanical Breakdown
Description: (Used on Water Only) Pump sewerage station stopped through mechanical error after equipment fails after being used incorrectly due to cyber attacks. Fixed through repair.
